rule: All public classes, methods, and interfaces must have Javadoc comments
suggested_fix: Add /** ... */ Javadoc with @param, @return, and @throws tags for all public APIs

rule: Javadoc comments must describe what the code does, not how it does it
suggested_fix: Focus on high-level behavior and purpose in Javadoc, implementation details in inline comments

rule: Use PascalCase for class names, camelCase for methods and variables, UPPER_CASE for constants
suggested_fix: Classes: EnergyMonitor, methods: calculatePower(), variables: motorSpeed, constants: MAX_VOLTAGE

rule: Package names must be all lowercase
Always specify access modifiers explicitly (public, private, protected, or package-private)
suggested_fix: Add explicit access modifiers to all class members - don't rely on default package-private

rule: Make fields private and provide public getters/setters as needed
suggested_fix: Change 'public int voltage' to 'private int voltage' with public getVoltage() method

rule: Use generics instead of raw types for type safety
suggested_fix: Replace 'List list' with 'List<String> list' or appropriate type parameter

rule: Prefer generic methods over raw method signatures
suggested_fix: Use <T> T getValue() instead of Object getValue() for better type safety

rule: No hardcoded passwords, API keys, or credentials
suggested_fix: Use environment variables, configuration files, or secure key stores

rule: Never catch generic Exception - catch specific exceptions
suggested_fix: Replace 'catch (Exception e)' with specific exceptions like 'catch (IOException e)'

rule: Don't swallow exceptions - log or rethrow them
suggested_fix: In catch blocks, use logger.error() or throw new RuntimeException(e) instead of empty catch
Use 'try (FileReader fr = new FileReader(file))' instead of manual close() calls

rule: Mark variables final when they are not reassigned
suggested_fix: Add 'final' keyword to method parameters and local variables that don't change
When overriding equals(), also override hashCode() to maintain hash-based collection contracts

rule: Use StringBuilder for string concatenation in loops
suggested_fix: Replace 'str += x' in loops with StringBuilder.append() to avoid creating many String objects

rule: Consider using Stream API for collection operations
suggested_fix: Replace traditional loops with stream operations like list.stream().filter().map().collect()
